page.title: 19Kellam's Farm (cont)
page.content: a few farm cats.The most modern building, a{pole barn}is 25 years old,but the silage clamp was built in 1980.They have a modern circular sheep-dip ,but there is an old one in the farmyard which is five feet deep at the end the sheep go in.Their vehicles include 1 landrover,2 tractors and two large lorries. Most of the land is managed grassland which is topdressed and let to local farmers on a 363 day or 7 month basis from April each year. The farm keeps 220{Northern Mule ewes.These are cross_breed between a {Swaledale Ewe}and a{Bluefaced {Leicester Ram.}The sheep breed an average of 1.6 lambs per year which are fattened on cake taken to Leicester or Melton Markets and Deakin's Slaughter House.The farm has 3 sheepdogs-Deke,Jet and Ross.
